Heading: Number of victims
Value: Confessed to 47, suspected of 14, convicted of 3

Heading: States where killing occurred
Value: OR, MT, UT, WA, CA, AZ, KS, FL, ID (28+ states)

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Father physically abused him to “straighten him out”

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Luggage handler, airport manager, roofer, and Christian missionary camp

Heading: Animal torture
Value: Yes; killed kitten by throwing it across a cactus and stabbed a victim’s dog

Heading: Abused drugs?
Value: Yes; heroin, pot, crack and methamphetamines

Heading: Been to a psychologist?
Value: Yes; in Vancouver and they told him to leave

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value: Yes; robbed neighbors home, felony auto theft, motorcycle theft and burglary

Heading: Victim type
Value: Drug dealers, veterans, FTRA members, and other male railroad-riders

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Method of killing
Value: Beat  head in (goon stick, pipe, 2x4, concrete slab, fence post, and his boots)

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Value: Yes-railroads were usually his victim’s home

Heading: Killing occurred in home of killer?
Weapon
Value: Brought with him and found at the scene

Heading: Tortured victims?
Value: No, except one time when it was with two other people

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Sentence
Value: Life in prison without parole because he made plea bargain

Heading:
References 
Palmini, W. G., & Chalupa, T. (2004).  Murder on the rails: Thetrue story of the detective who unlocked 	 the shocking secrets of the Boxcar Serial Killer.  NY: Horizon Press.
